newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazilian gunmen slay five after energy bill row.
newsitem.headline: Brazilian gunmen slay five after energy bill row.

text.p: Five people were murdered in a Sao Paulo slum in what police believe may have been a dispute over an electricity bill, newspapers reported on Saturday.
The Correio Braziliense newspaper said a 53-year-old mother and four members of her family were executed with shots to the head and chest early on Friday by three armed men.
Four members of the family, including the badly wounded father, survived.
Quoting a police commander in the Panorama shantytown, Correio said the family had shared an electricity line with neighbours and that there had been an argument about a bill.
It added that owners of the land had also ordered the eviction of the family.
"It may well have been some kind of revenge killing. Apart from the issue of the electricity bill, we will have to investigate the eviction order," said police commander Euclides Batista de Souza.
Newspapers said the murders brought the number of multiple killings in Sao Paulo to 46 this year, in which 162 people have died.
